intro: Cassipourea ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda cassipourea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa, particularly found in Uganda and neighboring regions. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in forests. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
